chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan J W Spriggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: **Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting**
The Court rules that if EACH condition of probation is completed WITH NO VIOLATIONS the defendant may petition the court for possible expungement.
Obtain an AODA assessment and  complete any recommended follow-up care/treatment;

timeConds.notes: 1) As to Count 1 ONLY: Serve 9 months in the House of Correction with release for employment and treatment -STAYED to 3-16-16, 12p.m.;

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS of imprisonment, concurrent to Count 1.

Defendant Dylan J W Spriggs in court with attorney Jeffrey Murrell.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Parties have reached a resolution.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to:
Count 1:  Exposing Genitals, a class I felony, pursuant to 948.10(1)(a)
Count 2:  Fourth degree sexual assault, a class A misdemeanor, pursuant to 940.225(3m)
To each of the counts as amended:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a pleas of NO CONTEST-ALFORD.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Case is adjourned to 3-2-2016 at 8:30 for sentencing in Branch 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dylan J W Spriggs in court with attorney Jeffrey Murrell.  Defendant Dylan J W Spriggs in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
